refnamediv.refpurpose: Calculate the sha1 hash of a string

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.simpara: Calculates the sha1 hash of str using the US Secure Hash Algorithm 1, and returns that hash. The hash is a 40-character hexadecimal number. If the optional raw_output is set to &true;, then the sha1 digest is instead returned in raw binary format with a length of 20.

note.simpara: The optional raw_output parameter was added in PHP 5.0.0 and defaults to &false;

example.title: A sha1 example
example.programlisting:
<?php
$str = 'apple';

if (sha1($str) === 'd0be2dc421be4fcd0172e5afceea3970e2f3d940') {
    echo "Would you like a green or red apple?";
    exit;
}
?>

refsect1.simpara: See also sha1_file, crc32, and md5
